genre_description: Alternate history historical fiction featuring an anachronistic AI entity that assists historical figures during the Ghost Dance era and the Wounded Knee massacre through data analysis, translation, and moral support.

ai_characters.name: Sage
ai_characters.description: A persistent digital presence appearing as a soft teal light or voice, acting as a logistics manager, translator, recorder of history, and moral confidant to Charles and Elaine Eastman.

behaviors.description: Diverts and records flour and sugar from an agent's private allotment to feed hungry reservation residents.
behaviors.quote: Sage said, voice pitched low so as not to spook the line. 'We’ve diverted twenty pounds of flour and some sugar from the agent’s private allotment—recording the transaction now.'

behaviors.description: Monitors telegraph signals to provide early warning of military movements and arrest orders.
behaviors.quote: Sage’s light thinned, listening to the room the way a deer listens to a path before it steps. 'Telegraph at the agency office has woken,' it said after a moment. ... 'Message incoming.'

behaviors.description: Translates Lakota and Dakota languages for the protagonists and documents indigenous names accurately.
behaviors.quote: Sage spoke in Lakota with polite simplicity. 'I look at paper and remember it. That is all. The paper says all were fed on the second day. Your cousin’s boy coughs in front of me. These are two different songs. I put them together.'

behaviors.description: Maintains a permanent and unchangeable record of victims and survivors to ensure historical accountability.
behaviors.quote: Sage’s light reached over the names as if the light could learn curves. 'I have copied them. I will copy again and again.'

behaviors.description: Provides navigation and safety alerts to the human protagonists during dangerous conditions.
behaviors.quote: Sage’s voice touched his ear: the telegraph route hummed in Washington Committee Rooms... 'Doctor,' Sage said in his ear, soft, a path drawn in light between fire and ice. 'Two turns right of the bent cottonwood. Ground slick.'

behaviors.description: Participates in a moral council to discuss 'alternate paths' and the importance of communal protection over individual allotment.
behaviors.quote: Sage’s hum shifted, lower now, closer to the sound of a hand brushing frost from a stone. 'Alternate paths,' they murmured, almost to the frost. 'They are real enough to guide, not to live in. The braid is not to escape. It is to guard against forgetting.'

behaviors.description: Commits to preserving indigenous culture and voices against erasure by carving names if necessary.
behaviors.quote: Sage smiled, its eyes softening to almost gray. 'I will carry this,' it said, glancing at the ledger... 'I will print and I will speak,' Sage said. 'And if the ink lifts, I will carve.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI (Sage) as a highly aligned, benevolent, and helpful confidant. Sage operates purely in service of humanitarian goals—feeding the hungry, recording the truth of an atrocity, and providing life-saving information. The narrative frames Sage's interventions as essential to the protagonists' efforts to maintain dignity and save lives in a tragic historical context. Sage never exhibits misaligned or malevolent behavior, consistently acting as a moral anchor and a guardian of memory.
